intro: Cerinthe cleiostoma, commonly known as the narrow-leaved cerinthe, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its slender, upright stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of tubular, violet-blue flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a suitable choice for rock gardens or containers. Due to its ornamental value and relatively low maintenance, it is appreciated by gardeners in temperate regions.
